group_works.title: Conservation tillage protecting our greatest asset

results.title: Protected
results.brief_description: Dramatised documentary by Alessandro Cavadini looking at the oppression of Aborigines by the administrators of the reserve on Palm Island, Queensland, through the Aborigines’ own improvised re-enactment of their abortive 1957 strike against conditions.

results.title: Protect your back
results.creator_credit: Yoralla Society of Victoria and Jane Nicholls
results.brief_description: Demonstrates safe lifting practices for families, friends and service providers of people with disabilities in community based environments. Overviews how the back works, risk factors and correct lifting practices. Provides guidelines for when the person being asisted can help or cannot communicate and assistance techniques including seating adjustment, discussing the lift, adjusting position in bed, transferring, assisted walking and lifting in a team.

results.title: Prospectus for growth
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how the investment of foreign capital contributes to the economic development of traditionally agricultural countries by promoting the growth and diversification of industry. It shows how capital investment from the United States has made possible improvemnets in the standard of living in Latin America, the Near East and Far East.

results.title: Prospects of Ireland
results.creator_credit: John Shearman, British Transport Films and Nick Nicholls
results.brief_description: Using traditional music as a background, this film shows the natural attractions and exciting activities available to tourists in Ireland.

results.title: Prospecting for petroleum
results.creator_credit: George Pal, Shell Film Unit and Duke Goldstone
results.brief_description: An account of man’s never-ending search for oil. Opens with a dramatized survey of the importance of oil in modern industrial economy, followed by an account of how oil is formed in the earth’s crust. Methods used by early oil prospectors are compared with the magnetic gravimetric and seismic surveys used in the modern search for oil. An animated film.

results.title: Prospecting
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Salesmanship”.
Explains that the foundations of successful selling is a systematic method of locating prospective customers. The methods of three successful salesmen are illustrated; one keeps his eyes and ears open through personal observation, one uses an initial sale to get a prospect for the next, and the third uses friends to give him additional contacts.

results.title: Prospect for a city
results.creator_credit: Alan Harper, Harper Films and Henry Cooper
results.brief_description: Edinburgh is an outstanding example of a planned city and this film was made to mark the bi-centenary of the plans of the first architect, James Craig. Today modern ideas of town planning are being incorporated in the old city of squares and vistas.

results.title: Prosecuting in the public interest
results.brief_description: The Office of the Commonwealth Director of Public Prosecutions was established in 1984 to provide an independent prosecutorial service under Federal law to the Australian Community. The office prosecutes crimes like drug smuggling and fraud and recovers the proceeds of crime from convicted criminals. This video provides an insight into the Commonwealth prosecution system in Australia by re-enacting two crimes, a heroin smuggling operation and a social security fraud, highlighting the interaction between the DPP and investigating agencies.
